column4: supergrub sounds like something that recovers grub on the mbr, but i dont even have grub installed. how can i install grub onto my ubuntu installation which wont boot, using just the livecd :P
i have no clue. done a ton of ubuntu installs. this is a new build. installed it twice from livecd, both time there is no grub in /boot
there is no grub directory to hold the menu.lst
Ok, what partition is Ubuntu installed on, and do you want Grub installed to the MBR of that disk?
the root partition is sda3, two empty partitions up front for windows later. i would like grub on the mbr
this is a brand new hdd
sudo mount /dev/sda3 /mnt && sudo grub-install /dev/sda && sudo mount -o bind /dev /mnt/dev && sudo chroot /mtn update-grub
the livecd says Could not find device for /boot: Not found or not a block device
grub-install from the livecd has not worked for me :/
can i just transfer /boot/grub/ from my laptop and put it onto my new build and just change all the partitions..
You might ask in #grub, but they want people to "Before you ask, see if you can reproduce your problem with GRUB 2" Grub2 is available in the repos if you want to try it but it's still in development
